title: Stand-alone NASIS Interpretation Engine
text: install alpha version “interpretation engine” R package install dependencies, use remotes get latest version GitHub. Input data @josephbrehm’s demonstration demonstrations can found inst/extdata portion repository. demonstration script input boundary files can found /demo folder. data try, can download repository static ZIP file, “clone” git can keep changes coming!
code: # install required packages  install.packages(c("XML", "caret", "data.tree", "digest", "doParallel", "dplyr",                     "foreach", "plyr", "raster", "soilDB", "forcats", "tidyr", "remotes"))                     # install package from ncss-tech interpretation-engine repository                    remotes::install_github('ncss-tech/interpretation-engine')

title: CVIR Evaluation Curves — CVIRSigmoid
code: CVIRSigmoid(x, xlim, ascending = TRUE)  CVIRComputeSCurve(x, xlim, ascending = TRUE)  CVIRTrapezoid(x, xlim)  CVIRBeta(x, xlim)  CVIRGauss(x, xlim)  CVIRTriangle(x, xlim)  CVIRPI(x, xlim)  CVIRLinear(x, xlim = NULL)

title: CVIR Evaluation Curves — CVIRSigmoid
text: x vector property values xlim x-axis limits (see details) ascending S-curve drawn ascending descending order? Default: TRUE

title: CVIR Evaluation Curves — CVIRSigmoid
text: vector fuzzy rating values derived specified curve equation

title: CVIR Evaluation Curves — CVIRSigmoid
text: describe number xlim parameters needed curve type

title: CVIR Evaluation Curves — CVIRSigmoid
code: x <- seq(0, 4, 0.01)  y <- CVIRSigmoid(x, c(0.5, 3)) plot(y ~ x)    x <- seq(0, 10, 0.01)  y <- CVIRTrapezoid(x, 2:5) plot(y ~ x)    x <- seq(0, 10, 0.01)  y <- CVIRBeta(x, c(2,2)) plot(y ~ x)    x <- seq(0, 10, 0.01)  y <- CVIRGauss(x, c(2,2)) plot(y ~ x)    x <- seq(0, 10, 0.01)  y <- CVIRTriangle(x, c(1,3)) plot(y ~ x)    x <- seq(0, 10, 0.01)  y <- CVIRPI(x, c(4, 1)) plot(y ~ x)   x <- seq(0, 10, 0.01)  y <- CVIRLinear(x, c(4, 1)) #> Warning: CVIRLinear xlim argument is ignored plot(y ~ x)

what: Function Generators for Interpolating Evaluation Curves — extractTrapezoidEval
title: Function Generators for Interpolating Evaluation Curves — extractTrapezoidEval
Function Generators for Interpolating Evaluation Curves — extractTrapezoidEval
code: extractTrapezoidEval(x, xlim, invert = FALSE)  extractArbitraryCurveEval(   x,   resolution = 1000,   method = "natural",   invert = FALSE,   bounded = TRUE )  extractArbitraryLinearCurveEval(x, xlim = NULL, invert = FALSE)  extractSigmoidCurveEval(x, xlim, invert = FALSE)  extractLinearCurveEval(x, xlim = NULL, invert = FALSE)  extractCrispCurveEval(x, xlim, invert = FALSE)  extractBetaCurveEval(x, xlim, invert = FALSE)  extractGaussCurveEval(x, xlim, invert = FALSE)  extractTriangleCurveEval(x, xlim, invert = FALSE)  extractPICurveEval(x, xlim, invert = FALSE)

title: Function Generators for Interpolating Evaluation Curves — extractTrapezoidEval
text: x evaluation XML content xlim domain points (see details) invert invert rating values? Default: FALSE resolution Number segments calculate spline points , interpolated splinefun(). Used extractArbitraryCurveEval(). Default 1000 method Passed splinefun(). Used extractArbitraryCurveEval(). Default "natural" bounded Used extractArbitraryCurveEval(). Used constrain spline results [0,1]. Default TRUE

title: Function Generators for Interpolating Evaluation Curves — extractTrapezoidEval
text: Generally xlim argument numeric vector length two refers upper lower boundaries domain (property value range) interest. case extractTrapezoidEval() xlim vector length 4 used specify x-axis position left base, two upper "plateau" boundaries, right base. arbitrary linear curves, xlim vector may length.

what: InterpretationEngine: Stand-alone NASIS Interpretation Engine — InterpretationEngine-package
title: InterpretationEngine: Stand-alone NASIS Interpretation Engine — InterpretationEngine-package
text: InterpretationEngine contains tools develop, test, apply interpretations soil data outside context NASIS. project aims create prototype existing interpretation rules, evaluations, properties managed NASIS. prototype complete possible generate fuzzy ratings arbitrary sources soil environmental data sources.

title: InterpretationEngine: Stand-alone NASIS Interpretation Engine — InterpretationEngine-package
text: Maintainer: Dylan Beaudette dylan.beaudette@usda.gov Authors: Joseph Brehm jrbrehm@nmsu.edu contributors: Andrew Brown andrew.g.brown@usda.gov [contributor]

what: Property Definition by Property Name — propdefByPropname
title: Property Definition by Property Name — propdefByPropname
Property Definition by Property Name — propdefByPropname
Property Definition by Property Name — propdefByPropname
Property Definition by Property Name — propdefByPropname
Property Definition by Property Name — propdefByPropname
code:
propdefByPropname("SOIL REACTION 1-1 WATER IN DEPTH 0-100cm (min)") #> [[1]] #>     propiid #> 442   10195 #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         propdesc #> 442 Finds the minimum value of soil reaction (pH) for the horizon that has any portion in a depths less than 40" (100 cm).
Portions outside the depth range are not considered in the horizon thickness.

Returns values for low, high and rv: each has a single value. #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         prop #> 442 base table component.
 
# Finds the minimum value of soil reaction (pH) for the horizon that has any portion in a depths less than 40" (100 cm).
 
exec sql select hzdept_r, hzdepb_r, ph1to1h2o_l, ph1to1h2o_h, ph1to1h2o_r, ph01mcacl2_l, ph01mcacl2_h, ph01mcacl2_r
    from  component, chorizon
    where join component to chorizon and (hzdept_r < 100 or hzdept_r=100);
    sort by hzdept_r, hzdepb_r
    aggregate column  ph1to1h2o_l min, ph1to1h2o_h min, ph1to1h2o_r min, ph01mcacl2_l min, ph01mcacl2_h min, ph01mcacl2_r min.
    
    define rv NOT ISNULL (ph1to1h2o_r) ? ph1to1h2o_r : ph01mcacl2_r.
    define low NOT ISNULL (ph1to1h2o_l) ? ph1to1h2o_l : ph01mcacl2_l.
    define high NOT ISNULL (ph1to1h2o_h) ? ph1to1h2o_h : ph01mcacl2_h. #>

title: Evaluate a tree — tree_eval
text: tree tree data tree object structured classifications leaves , nodes must contain attributes: "var", specifying variable name evaluate, "logical", specifying logical evaluation step. MUST INCLUDE VARIABLE "VAR" indata data must data frame containing columns names matching values "var" used tree object ncores number cores parallelize . set 1 (default), runs sequentially. Also accepts "auto" input. run ncores computer - 2.
